scenes.plot_segment: Meredith Grey narrates about the world of surgery, explaining that some people are naturally suited for it while others are not. She reflects on the legacy of her mother, Ellis Grey, a renowned surgeon, and admits to feeling unprepared herself. As the narration continues, Meredith wakes up in bed next to Derek Shepherd after a one-night stand. Embarrassed and anxious about being late for her first day as a surgical intern, she urges Derek to leave quickly. During their brief, awkward conversation, Meredith reveals she has just moved from Boston and is selling her mother’s house. Derek tries to make small talk, but Meredith insists on keeping things impersonal and tells him goodbye before hurrying to get ready for work.

Meredith Grey wakes up in her mother’s house after a one-night stand with Derek Shepherd. Embarrassed and anxious about being late for her first day as a surgical intern, Meredith urges Derek to leave. As they get dressed, Derek tries to make conversation, asking if Meredith lives there. She explains she just moved from Boston and is selling her mother’s house. When Derek assumes her mother is dead, Meredith awkwardly clarifies that she is not. Both agree not to exchange personal details. As Meredith heads to the shower, Derek introduces himself, and Meredith reluctantly shares her name before saying goodbye.

Meredith Grey joins a group of new surgical interns—Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens—in the hospital lobby. Dr. Richard Webber, the Chief of Surgery, addresses them with a stern warning that they are now doctors, not students, and that the next seven years will be the most challenging and rewarding of their lives, though many will not make it through the program. Dr. Miranda Bailey, known as "The Nazi," introduces herself as their resident and lays out her five strict rules for survival: no sucking up, answer every page at a run, never wake her unless a patient is dying, don’t let a patient be dead when she arrives, and always move when she moves. Meredith internally reflects on her anxiety and feelings of unpreparedness as she stands among her new colleagues, aware of the high expectations and the legacy of her mother, Ellis Grey.

Meredith Grey joins Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens in a hospital corridor as they wait to begin their first day as surgical interns. The group awkwardly introduces themselves, with George nervously recalling meeting Meredith at a mixer, while Cristina quickly sizes up the competition. The interns discuss the small number of women among them and gossip about Izzie’s past as a model, prompting some skepticism. As they compare which resident they have been assigned to, they learn they are all under Dr. Miranda Bailey, who is rumored to be strict and is referred to as "The Nazi." Dr. Bailey arrives and calls out their names—O'Malley, Yang, Grey, Stevens—summoning them to follow her as their surgical internship officially begins.

Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens gather with the other new surgical interns as Dr. Miranda Bailey arrives to introduce herself as their resident. The group is surprised to learn that Dr. Bailey, known by the intimidating nickname "The Nazi," is a petite woman. The interns quietly speculate about her reputation and whether she is as tough as rumored. Izzie introduces herself as Isobel Stevens, and the group exchanges nervous glances. Dr. Bailey immediately establishes her authority by laying out five strict rules: no sucking up, answer every page at a run, never wake her unless a patient is dying, don’t let the patient be dead when she arrives, and always move when she moves. She informs them that their first shift will last 48 hours and assigns specific tasks to each intern, making it clear that discipline and hard work are expected. Dr. Bailey instructs the interns to follow her closely, signaling the start of their demanding surgical training.

A medical emergency is announced as Katie Bryce, a 15-year-old pageant contestant, is rushed in with seizures. Dr. Miranda Bailey leads the group of new surgical interns—Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, George O’Malley, and Izzie Stevens—alongside Dr. Preston Burke. Dr. Bailey quickly assigns tasks: Cristina is sent to run labs, George is told to handle patient workups, and Meredith is put in charge of Katie, including taking her for a CT scan, making Katie her responsibility. Izzie is assigned to perform rectal exams on multiple patients. As the interns scramble to follow Bailey’s orders, Meredith tries to reassure the anxious Katie, who is upset about missing her pageant, while Cristina and George begin their assigned tasks and Izzie reluctantly heads off to her less glamorous duty.

In a hospital corridor, Cristina Yang approaches Meredith Grey and asks what she is doing there, surprised to see her outside the patient rooms. George O'Malley joins them and reports that Katie Bryce’s lab results are normal, leaving her seizures unexplained. Cristina mentions a rumor that Dr. Bailey will let the best intern perform a procedure on the first day. Meredith, distracted and anxious about her responsibilities, tells George and Cristina to leave so she can focus on her tasks.

George O'Malley tries to reassure a nervous patient, Tony Savage, who jokes about his upcoming bypass surgery and the hospital food restrictions. George assures Tony that Dr. Burke is an excellent surgeon and that he is in good hands. Meanwhile, Izzie Stevens gets lost in the hospital corridors and is told by a nurse that she is on the wrong floor. Meredith Grey checks on Katie Bryce, who is frustrated about missing the Spokane Teen Miss pageant, where she was a top contender. Katie vents her disappointment and asks Meredith if she is new, clearly upset about her situation.

Izzie Stevens prepares to perform a rectal exam on a patient as part of her intern duties. In the adjacent bed, Katie Bryce, frustrated about missing her rhythmic gymnastics pageant due to her seizures, complains to Meredith Grey about being assigned to an intern she perceives as inexperienced. Katie vents about twisting her ankle during rehearsal and sarcastically remarks that she and Meredith will have plenty of fun together in the hospital. Meredith tries to reassure Katie while managing her own nerves and exhaustion on her first day.

In the hospital break room, Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens gather after a grueling start to their shift. Izzie complains about having to perform numerous rectal exams, saying she can’t eat after doing seventeen in a row. George worries that Dr. Miranda Bailey dislikes him, while Cristina is focused on impressing the attendings. The group’s conversation shifts to Meredith, with Cristina revealing to George and Izzie that Meredith’s mother is Ellis Grey, the renowned surgeon. Cristina and Izzie discuss Ellis Grey’s groundbreaking achievements, while George is surprised by the revelation. Izzie vents about their first patient, Katie Bryce, calling her difficult and high-maintenance. Dr. Bailey enters abruptly, silencing their chatter, and announces that the intern who shows the most promise will be given the honor of performing the first surgery. She reveals that George has been selected to scrub in for an appendectomy, leaving the others both surprised and envious as George nervously prepares for his first operation.

Dr. Richard Webber and Dr. Miranda Bailey discuss George O'Malley's selection for the first surgery. Dr. Webber questions whether George is ready, noting that he barely made it into the program. Dr. Bailey insists that George is her choice, explaining that designating one intern as the "sacrificial lamb" helps keep the others in line. Meanwhile, Katie Bryce's hospital room is mentioned as her parents arrive, anxious about her worsening condition and the possibility of surgery. Izzie Stevens, caught off guard by their questions, admits she is not Katie's doctor and quickly leaves to find Dr. Shepherd or another attending for answers.

In the intern locker room, George O'Malley nervously asks Cristina Yang who should be the one to talk to Katie Bryce’s parents about her condition. Izzie Stevens joins them, and Cristina tells George that Dr. Derek Shepherd is now Katie’s attending physician, so he should handle it. Meredith Grey approaches Dr. Shepherd in the hallway and realizes he is Derek, the man she spent the previous night with. They exchange awkward glances as Meredith insists that their relationship must remain strictly professional now that he is her attending. Derek tries to lighten the mood, but Meredith firmly states that nothing can happen between them and walks away, determined to focus on her responsibilities as an intern.

In the surgical viewing gallery, Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and other interns watch as George O'Malley is selected by Dr. Miranda Bailey to perform an appendectomy on a patient, with Dr. Preston Burke supervising. The interns, led by Cristina, place bets on whether George will succeed or fail, joking nervously about the pressure. George begins the surgery and initially handles the procedure well, carefully removing the appendix as Dr. Burke observes. However, when George accidentally tears the cecum, the patient begins to bleed heavily. George freezes in panic, unable to control the situation, and Dr. Burke quickly intervenes to stop the bleeding and finish the surgery. Afterward, Dr. Burke harshly criticizes George in front of everyone, calling him out for his mistake. In the gallery, Cristina and the others dub George "007," mocking him with the nickname "license to kill" for his perceived incompetence in the operating room.

George O'Malley, still shaken after his failed appendectomy and the humiliation of being nicknamed "007" by his fellow interns, confronts Cristina Yang, Izzie Stevens, and Meredith Grey in the hallway about the nickname. Cristina and Izzie deny calling him "007," but George remains suspicious and hurt by their teasing. Meredith tries to defuse the tension, but before the conversation can continue, Dr. Miranda Bailey pages the interns with an urgent call about Katie Bryce’s deteriorating condition. The group immediately drops the argument and rushes off together to respond to the emergency.

Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens gather in the hospital hallway, exhausted after their first shift. They commiserate about the overwhelming difficulty of surgical residency, joking that working in geriatrics would be easier. George nervously suggests they should find a place to live together, hinting at Meredith’s housing situation. Meanwhile, elsewhere in the hospital, Izzie responds to a 911 page for Katie Bryce, only to find Katie is simply bored and wants to watch her pageant on television. Izzie firmly tells Katie not to misuse emergency pages and encourages her to get some rest, reminding her that the staff’s time is valuable.

George O'Malley nervously approaches Izzie Stevens for help starting a central line on Mr. Jones, admitting he has never done the procedure before. They debate whether to ask Dr. Miranda Bailey for assistance but hesitate, recalling her strict rule about not waking her unless a patient is dying. Eventually, George gathers the courage to approach Dr. Bailey, who is visibly irritated at being disturbed. She curtly reminds them not to bother her unless the patient is at death’s door and warns that if she is woken again without good reason, the patient had better be dying.

In the hospital hallway, a nurse suggests that a patient may not have pneumonia, but George O'Malley, eager to assert himself on his first day, dismisses her concerns and orders antibiotics. Alex Karev, another new intern, introduces himself to the group with a cocky attitude and makes a derogatory remark about nurses, assuming Izzie Stevens is one. Izzie immediately corrects him, making it clear she is a surgical intern. Alex then asks about Cristina Yang, showing interest in her, but George tells him to stop talking, uncomfortable with Alex’s attitude.

Katie Bryce begins seizing uncontrollably in her hospital bed, experiencing multiple grand mal seizures. Meredith Grey, assigned to Katie’s care, quickly checks her chart and lists the medications already administered—lorazepam and phenobarbital—but notes that neither has stopped the seizures. Dr. Miranda Bailey arrives and asks Meredith for an update; Meredith reports the interventions taken so far. As the seizures continue, Katie’s heart suddenly stops. Meredith, Cristina Yang, and George O’Malley work together to initiate resuscitation, performing chest compressions and preparing the defibrillator. Dr. Bailey supervises and orders them to continue efforts as the team shocks Katie’s heart multiple times. After several tense moments, Katie’s heart rhythm returns and she is stabilized. Dr. Bailey sternly reprimands Meredith for not paging her immediately when Katie’s condition deteriorated, reminding her that if a patient dies, it is Bailey’s responsibility, not the intern’s. The interns are visibly shaken as Bailey emphasizes the seriousness of their roles.

Katie Bryce’s parents, Mr. and Mrs. Bryce, confront Dr. Derek Shepherd in the hallway, visibly upset that their daughter still has no diagnosis after her cardiac arrest. Dr. Shepherd admits he does not yet know what is causing Katie’s seizures but assures them he is doing everything possible to find answers. Mr. Bryce, frustrated, demands that another doctor take over Katie’s case, but Dr. Shepherd calmly insists he is committed to helping Katie and asks for their trust. Meanwhile, in a nearby patient room, George O’Malley, still shaken from his failed surgery, stands with Cristina Yang as Dr. Preston Burke explains to the family of Tony Savage that bypass surgery was necessary. George tries to reassure Tony’s wife that everything will be fine, but after the patient dies unexpectedly, Dr. Burke sternly reprimands George for making promises he cannot keep, reminding him that only God can guarantee outcomes. Dr. Burke instructs George to inform Mrs. Savage about her husband’s death, emphasizing the gravity of their responsibilities as doctors.

In the break room, George O'Malley tries to stay awake by practicing sutures on a banana, while Izzie Stevens apologizes to Cristina Yang for being irritable when tired. Meredith Grey joins them, and the group speculates about why they’ve been called in so late. Dr. Derek Shepherd enters and asks the interns for help diagnosing Katie Bryce, promising that whoever finds the answer will get to scrub in on her surgery. Dr. Miranda Bailey arrives and hands out Katie’s chart, instructing the interns to review her case and report their findings. The interns quickly gather around, eager for the opportunity and determined to prove themselves.

An intern pages Dr. Miranda Bailey about an elderly patient who remains short of breath, but Bailey brusquely dismisses the concern, telling the intern the patient is simply old and to stop paging her unless it’s truly urgent. Meanwhile, Cristina Yang approaches Meredith Grey and proposes they work together on Katie Bryce’s case, suggesting that whoever helps solve it will get to assist in surgery. Meredith agrees, admitting she wants to avoid Dr. Derek Shepherd. When Cristina presses her for a reason, Meredith quietly confides that she slept with Dr. Shepherd before realizing he was an attending at the hospital. The two then focus on reviewing Katie’s symptoms and medical history, methodically ruling out possible diagnoses as they search for the cause of her seizures.

Cristina Yang corners Meredith Grey in the hospital hallway and pointedly asks if Dr. Derek Shepherd was good in bed, referencing Meredith’s secret one-night stand. Meredith tries to deflect, but Cristina presses for details, emphasizing the competitive nature of their internship. Their conversation shifts to Katie Bryce, the teenage patient with unexplained seizures. Cristina worries that if Katie dies, she’ll never have the chance to become her own person. As they discuss Katie’s background as a rhythmic gymnast and her recent minor fall during rehearsal, Meredith suddenly connects the dots and realizes the fall could have caused a rare brain aneurysm. Excited, Meredith and Cristina rush to find Dr. Shepherd and urgently present their theory that Katie may have a subarachnoid hemorrhage resulting from the fall. Although initially skeptical, Dr. Shepherd listens to their reasoning and orders further tests to investigate the possibility.

Dr. Derek Shepherd gathers Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens to review Katie Bryce’s latest CT scans. Meredith and Cristina present their findings, explaining that Katie’s minor fall during pageant rehearsal likely caused a rare brain aneurysm, resulting in a minute subarachnoid hemorrhage visible on the scan. Dr. Shepherd confirms their diagnosis, commends Meredith and Cristina for their teamwork and insight, and tells Meredith she has earned the opportunity to scrub in on Katie’s brain surgery. Cristina, though disappointed, acknowledges Meredith’s achievement as the group prepares for the operation.

Cristina Yang is visibly frustrated and disappointed after Dr. Derek Shepherd selects Meredith Grey to assist in Katie Bryce’s brain surgery, recognizing Meredith’s role in diagnosing the subarachnoid hemorrhage. Cristina tries to hide her disappointment but cannot help feeling overlooked despite her hard work and ambition. Meredith, aware of the tension, hesitates but ultimately accepts the opportunity, understanding the significance of the moment for her career. As Cristina processes her setback, Meredith reflects on how unpredictable and competitive surgical training can be, realizing that sometimes opportunities arise unexpectedly and must be seized, even at the risk of straining new friendships.

Dr. Preston Burke informs George O'Malley that their bypass patient, Tony Savage, has died due to irreversible heart damage sustained during surgery. George is visibly shaken, having previously assured Tony’s wife, Gloria, that her husband would be fine. Dr. Burke sternly reprimands George for making promises he cannot keep and instructs him to deliver the news to Gloria himself. Struggling with guilt and anxiety, George approaches Gloria in the waiting area and quietly tells her that Tony did not survive the operation. Gloria is devastated by the news, breaking down in grief as George stands by, overwhelmed and remorseful.

Izzie Stevens reassures Katie Bryce as she prepares her for brain surgery, lightening the mood by joking about making her look like a "bald beauty queen." In the hallway, Meredith Grey approaches Dr. Derek Shepherd and quietly asks if he chose her to assist in Katie’s surgery because they slept together. Derek teases her with a "yes," then clarifies that she earned the spot by helping diagnose Katie’s condition. Meredith insists that Cristina Yang deserves the opportunity instead, but Derek encourages Meredith to see the case through, telling her not to let their personal history interfere with her professional growth.

George O'Malley and Cristina Yang sit together in the hospital lounge, sharing their anxieties about the pressures of being surgical interns. George confides that his mother always doubted his ability to become a surgeon, while Cristina admits her own mother questioned her career choice. They joke about how being seen as superheroes by their families would be nice, but both are uncertain if they will survive the grueling program. Their conversation reveals their vulnerability and the weight of expectations they carry as they begin their journey at Seattle Grace.

Dr. Miranda Bailey quizzes George O'Malley about a post-operative patient with a fever, pressing him for possible causes. George hesitates and struggles to answer, prompting Cristina Yang to confidently list the five Ws of post-op fever: Wind, Water, Wound, Walking, and Wonder drugs. Dr. Bailey emphasizes that pneumonia is often assumed without proper investigation and challenges the interns to consider other diagnoses, suggesting a pulmonary embolism as the likely cause. She instructs George to order the appropriate tests and follow protocol. As the group disperses, Dr. Richard Webber approaches Meredith Grey, recognizes her as Ellis Grey’s daughter, and warmly welcomes her to the hospital, acknowledging her mother’s legacy.

Dr. Derek Shepherd gathers the group of surgical interns—Meredith Grey, Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens—in the hospital hallway, declaring, “It’s a beautiful night to save lives,” and encouraging them to enjoy the work despite the pressure. Meredith and Cristina, both exhausted but exhilarated after their first day, agree to avoid having an emotional conversation, joking about their disheveled appearances. As the team prepares for the next challenge, Meredith’s narration reflects on the burdens and rewards of being a surgeon—the responsibility, the uncertainty, and the love for the job that keeps them going. The interns share a moment of camaraderie, teasing each other and finding comfort in their shared experience as they face the long night ahead.

In the operating room, George O'Malley, still reeling from his earlier humiliation, watches as Meredith Grey and Cristina Yang assist Dr. Derek Shepherd in surgery. Cristina, exhilarated by the experience, quietly tells Meredith that assisting in the OR is a rush better than any drug. Meredith, sharing Cristina’s sense of accomplishment, allows herself a brief smile as they exchange a look of pride and relief. The two interns savor the moment, recognizing the thrill and satisfaction of surviving their first surgery together, even as exhaustion and uncertainty linger in the background.

Meredith Grey narrates as she and her fellow interns—Cristina Yang, George O'Malley, and Izzie Stevens—finish their first exhausting shift at Seattle Grace Hospital. Reflecting on the day, Meredith admits she likes her new colleagues and feels a sense of camaraderie despite the challenges they faced. She decides not to sell her mother Ellis Grey’s house, choosing instead to stay and invite roommates to move in. As Meredith visits her mother, who is suffering from memory loss, she gently reminds Ellis of her legacy as a renowned surgeon. Meredith contemplates the pressures and rewards of surgical life, acknowledging that, despite the difficulties, she is drawn to the work and ready to face what comes next with her fellow interns.

Meredith Grey visits her mother, Ellis Grey, at the care facility. Ellis, confused and suffering from memory loss, does not recognize Meredith and mistakes her for a stranger. Ellis reminisces about her past, mentioning she used to be a doctor, but cannot recall the specifics. Meredith gently reminds her that she was not just a doctor, but a renowned surgeon. Ellis remains distant and detached, leaving Meredith quietly heartbroken as she sits with her mother, struggling with the reality of Ellis’s condition.
